re-assigned to Joe.
Jared can test on linux, but Joe was original developer.
Fixed in JavaStepFilterPreferencePage#cleanupEditor().
Please verify.

Verified that the described problem is fixed in your HEAD stream, but found 
another problem that is likely a direct result of the changes.  Looking at the 
trace below, perhaps it's a jface problem?  Steps (motif):

- go to Step Filtering preference page
- press Add Filter button
- type something, but don't press Enter
- press the Add Filter button again
- if this doesn't cause a problem, repeat the above two steps once more and 
you'll definitely hit it
- get the following NPE:

Fixed original problem in ExceptionBreakpointFilterEditor.
I cannot reproduce the second problem Grant describes on Windows.
It only happens with Motif.

I cannot reproduce the second problem on Linux-Motif running the latest code
from the repository.

Can you please provide excruciating detail? What filters are listed when you
start? What text do you enter? etc.

- self-hosting in 0402 drop
- contents of org.eclipse.jdt.debug and org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui plugins taken 
from HEAD stream
- all other content imported from the 0402 plugins

I can reproduce it fairly easily.  Steps:
- open Preferences dialog
- go to Step Filtering page
- top checkbox is checked

OK, I can duplicate the NPE in TableViewer.internalRemove() by rapid clicking on
the Add Filter button on RH7.2 with Gnome, but could not duplicate it by
clicking Add FIlter, typing, clicking Add FIlter, typing, etc.

Interestingly, I can also see the NPE in TableViewer.internalRemove() on WinXP, but through a 
different path.  Rapidly click Add Filter a bunch of times, then giver focus to the in-place editor 
and hit ESC.  The workbench dies on the exception.  I think the best way to handle all of these issues 
is simply to disable the Add Filter button while an in-place editor is active.  This may result in 
some small loss of functionality, but not much.

Deferring.  Not a critical usability issue.  We could disable the Add Filter button while an in-
place editor is active, but this problem only occurs when the Add Filter button is rapidly 
clicked, which is not normal behavior.
Resolving to later.
Moving
Moving to SWT

The swt motif issue that originally required a workaround on your end has been 
dealt with, so you should take out your workaround (take out the asynchronous 
execution of the two lines in JavaStepFilterPreferencePage.cleanupEditor()).  
I've verified that doing so makes win32 and motif run nicely, and eliminates 
the side-effects that the workaround introduced.  Sorry about requesting the 
original change and then taking it back five months later.
Moving back to debug.
Fixed as Grant suggested.
